channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Teachers are using software to see if students used AI. What happens when it's wrong?
item.description: School districts from Utah to Ohio to Alabama are spending thousands of dollars on these tools, despite research showing the technology is far from re...

item.title: The Warner Bros. Curse
item.description: Warner Bros. has a history of disastrous mergers and acquisitions. Can they avoid another bad sequel as Netflix and Paramount battle to buy it?

item.title: Built to spill: The life of a crash test dummy
item.description: Automotive crash test dummies are born in Ohio, brought to "life" near Detroit, and then sent around the world to make cars safer.

item.title: Mahmood Mamdani on how Uganda's history shaped his belonging — and his son's moment
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Professor Mahmood Mamdani about his new book, "Slow Poison." The book is a firsthand report on the tragic unraveling of ...

item.title: Republicans divided on policy toward Afghan immigrants after shooting
item.description: The signs of Republican pushback come as President Trump has pursued a campaign of mass deportations and crackdown on migration from certain countries...

item.title: Who are the Bondi shooting victims?
item.description: Authorities say two rabbis, a Holocaust survivor and a 10-year-old girl were among the victims.

item.title: Killings of Rob Reiner and his wife stun Hollywood as decision on charges for their son looms
Taekwondo instructor learns fate for killing 7-year-old student, parents
item.description: After killing the boy and his mother, he took her Apple watch and drove her BMW to the family home where he stabbed the boy's father to death.

item.title: Brown University shooting leaves students, community frustrated with official response
item.description: The effort to find a man who walked onto Brown University’s campus and shot nearly a dozen students in a crowded lecture hall has raised serious quest...

item.title: FDA warns 4 major retailers about selling recalled ByHeart infant formula
item.description: Four of the nation's top retail stores failed to promptly pull contaminated ByHeart infant formula from their shelves, federal health officials said i...

item.title: French court sentences ex-DR Congo rebel and politician to 30 years in jail
item.description: In a landmark trial, Roger Lumbala faced accusations about atrocities committed during the Second Congo war.

item.title: Dashcam video shows couple trying to stop gunman before being killed in Bondi attack
item.description: Boris Gurman, 69, "charged straight towards the danger" and grabbed one of the attacker's guns, a witness says.

item.title: Rob Reiner's son Nick arrested on suspicion of murder after director and wife found dead
item.description: The couple's son is in custody after the couple was found dead in their home on Sunday.

item.title: 'Best of our country': Australian PM visits Bondi hero in hospital
item.description: "Your heart is strong", Anthony Albanese tells the father-of-two, calling him "a true Australian hero".

item.title: 12/15: CBS Evening News
item.description: Police seek person of interest in Brown University shooting; Rob Reiner and wife Michele found dead, son arrested.

item.title: Grand Canyon hotels on South Rim reopening after water pipeline repaired
item.description: Hotels and lodges will welcome back visitors to the Grand Canyon's South Rim after the national park fixed multiple breaks in a water pipeline that le...

item.title: Raskin to introduce bill to require review of White House renovation plans
item.description: Rep. Jamie Raskin wants to see White House construction like President Trump's ballroom project subjected to the same scrutiny as other federal projec...

item.title: An aspiring neurosurgeon and a campus Republican died in the Brown campus shooting
